page.title: 01Belsay_General description
page.content: This 12 Km block lies between the villages of Belsay and Bolam. It is undulating country with irregular fields surrounded by thorn hedges with a good number of mature hedgerow trees. The land is used for growing cereals, roots, and grass mainly as stockfeed as it is traditionally beef and lamb producing area. There are 10 farmsteads, a total of 31 houses and a population of 80 persons. Most of the residents are employed on the land or in support of the landworkers. The area is 'greenbelt'and no developement other than a by_pass for Belsay village is proposed. The nearest cattle markets are at Ponteland 6 miles or Newcastle 14 miles away. Leisure activities are generally home orientated as anything else involves a journey of 20 or 30 miles.
